body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
After a succesfull initialization and fully working setup the operator updates our OSD deployments in a way that they fail to start.

**Expected behavior:**
The OSD pods start without error.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
On our platform we've triggered this bug 2 times, but I don't know of a general reproduction.

Short description of our setup:
- Local block based PVs based on LVM logical volumes (using the local-static-provisioner with symlinks: /media/lbd/rook-ceph-data/d1 -> /dev/main/lbd_rook-ceph-data_d1)
- Rook-ceph initialized using 1.2.5 and recently upgraded to 1.2.7 (both exhibiting this problem)
- Each update by the operator sets `ROOK_LV_BACKED_PV="false"` on the OSD deployments, which we have to change to `ROOK_LV_BACKED_PV="true"` to make things work again

Additional information:

The first time the operator updated the OSD deployments it also configured the wrong `ROOK_LV_PATH` (it was `main/lbd_rook-ceph-data_d1` instead of `/dev/main/lbd_rook-ceph-data_d1`), which lead to it failing to parse LV information. But after we manually updated all deployments this error went away and it never again changed the `ROOK_LV_PATH` to the wrong value.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.19.67-2 (from Debian)
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Azure VM
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.2.7
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 14.2.8
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.14.1
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): Bare metal
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): HEALTH_OK
title: Rook-ceph doesn't recognize our disks as ROOK_LV_BACKED_PV
